validations.alphanumericPattern: Only lower case alphanumeric characters and dashes "-" are allowed. The first character must be a lower case letter. The last character can not be a dash. Must be between 3 and 63 characters.
validations.alphanumericPatternNoLength: Only lower case alphanumeric characters and dashes "-" are allowed. The first character must be a lower case letter. The last character can not be a dash.
validations.alphanumericPatternStepAdminUser: Only lower case alphanumeric characters and dashes "-" are allowed. The first character must be a lower case letter. The last character can not be a dash. Must be between 5 and 63 characters.
validations.incorrectAwsAccount: AWS Account ID should be a 12-digit number
validations.incorrectAwsVpc: AWS VPC ID should start from "vpc-" and doesn't have spaces
validations.userNameMin: Username must be at least {{value}} characters
validations.firstNameMax: First name is too long - must be {{maxLength}} chars maximum.
validations.lastNameMax: Last name is too long - must be {{maxLength}} chars maximum.
validations.emailValidation: This is not a valid email
validations.emailMax: Email is too long - must be {{maxLength}} chars maximum.
validations.companyNameMax: Company name is too long - must be {{maxLength}} chars maximum.
validations.passwordMin: Password must be at least {{value}} characters
validations.passwordValidation: Passwords must contain: a minimum of 1 lower case letter [a-z] and a minimum of 1 upper case letter [A-Z]
validations.passwordMax: Password is too long - must be {{maxLength}} chars maximum.
validations.acceptAgreement: Please accept the agreement to continue.
validations.accountMax: Account is too long - must be {{maxLength}} chars maximum.
validations.retentionMinDays: Too less retention period - must be {{minLength}} day minimum.
validations.retentionMaxDays: Too much retention period - must be {{maxLength}} days maximum.
validations.timeIntervalMinDays: Too less time interval - must be {{minLength}} day minimum.
validations.timeIntervalMaxDays: Too much time interval - must be {{maxLength}} days maximum.
validations.maxPerfMetrics: Can't display less than {{min}} and more than {{max}} metrics at a time
validations.duplicateAllowlistEntry: Duplicate allowlist names are not allowed

login.resendActivationSubtitle: Enter the email address associated with your account

signup.welcome: Welcome!  Create a free YugabyteDB Managed account to get started
signup.passwordHelper: Minimum 8 characters; must have a combination of at least one lower case, one uppercase, one numbers and one special character
signup.agreeToTermsAndPolicy: By clicking the "Start using YugabyteDB Managed" button, you are creating a Yugabyte account, and you agree to Yugabyte’s <1>{{termsOfUse}}</1>.
signup.consentTextYes: Yes, I do want Yugabyte to send me e-mails about products, services, and events that it thinks may interest me.
signup.consentTextNo: No, I do NOT want Yugabyte to send me e-mails about products, services, and events that it thinks may interest me.
signup.successMessage: Signup successful, you will be redirected

managed.featureAvailableWith: This feature is coming soon! To experience it now, please sign up for YugabyteDB Managed.

If you don’t see an email make sure to check your spam folder.
Link expired? <1>{{resendMail}}.
sendVerificationMail.successMessage: If an account is associated with {{mailAddress}}, you will receive a verification link.

If you don’t see an email make sure to check your spam folder.
Link expired? <1>{{resendMail}}.

getStarted.title: Get started by adding a free cluster
getStarted.line1: Have a fully functioning cluster ready in minutes deployed to the region of your choice
getStarted.line2: No credit card information is required.
getStarted.feature1Title: An RDBMS built for the cloud
getStarted.feature2Subtitle: Your business-critical apps stay up no matter what
getStarted.feature3Title: Scale with just a few clicks
getStarted.feature3Subtitle: Handle workloads irrespective of the demand

quickStart.title: Quick start guide
quickStart.text: We will guide you through creating a cluster, accessing via cloud shell and then querying data.

productOverview.title: Product overview
productOverview.text: Learn about Yugabyte's capabilities and user interface with a short video

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.text: Get started with our product documentation to explore different features

welcome.addCC: Add a credit card to this account.

welcomeNew.header: The multi-cloud relational database-as-a-service for developers
welcomeNew.subHeader2: Use our guided tutorial to learn about YugabyteDB in under 15 minutes
welcomeNew.tutorialStep2: Learn how to use YugabyteDB with sample data and queries
welcomeNew.tutorialStep3: Connect to a sample app that matches your use case

onboardingTutorial.step1Description: Create a YugabyteDB cluster to get started
onboardingTutorial.step2Description: Find out how YugabyteDB works through SQL feature demos and pre-built queries
onboardingTutorial.step2Cta: Launch Cloud Shell to Get Started
onboardingTutorial.step3Description: Download and run a simple app in your programming language of choice. ➔
onboardingTutorial.step4Header: Based on your survey answers we recommend
onboardingTutorial.step4DescriptionEvaluator: Discover how YugabyteDB ensures multi-cloud deployments are resilient, scalable, and continuously available.
onboardingTutorial.step4TitleBuilder: Get started building your own application
onboardingTutorial.step4DescriptionBuilder: Select your favorite programming language to connect an application to YugabyteDB's API client libraries.
onboardingTutorial.step4TitleStudent: Expand your horizons with Yugabyte University
onboardingTutorial.step4DescriptionStudent: Enroll in free on-demand courses, virtual training, and builder workshops on distributed SQL and YugabyteDB.

announcement.feature1Subtitle: Self service dedicated VPCs - Create and manage VPCs for your clusters with a few simple clicks. Go to the Network Access tab to explore.
announcement.feature2Subtitle: Use slow and live query analyzer to investigate query performance issues. Try it under any of your cluster's Performance tab.
announcement.feature3Subtitle: Use activity logs to get a 360 view of changes made by users within your account. Activity logs are available under the Admin section.

cloudShell.launchDescription: To launch the Cloud Shell confirm your database username and API type
cloudShell.learnHowToUse: Learn how to use Cloud Shell.
cloudShell.errorMaxConnections: No available connections. Please terminate an existing shell session or wait a couple minutes and try again.
cloudShell.browserSupportInfo: For Windows or Firefox, use right-click to {{COPY}} / {{PASTE}} when using Cloud Shell

clusterWizard.noPaymentMethod: You need a credit card to deploy a paid tier cluster.
clusterWizard.addCreditCardToProceed: To proceed add a credit card to this account.
clusterWizard.freeTierDescription2: For basic development and product evaluation use cases.
clusterWizard.oneFreeTierClusterPerAccount: Limit of one free cluster per account

clusterWizard.noCCRequired: No credit card information is required.
clusterWizard.paidTierComingSoon: YugabyteDB Managed Paid Tier coming soon!
clusterWizard.clusterSizePaidTier: Size the cluster for your workload
clusterWizard.freeTierFeature1: Cloud shell to run SQL queries from the browser
clusterWizard.freeTierFeature2: Data encryption at rest and in transit
clusterWizard.freeTierFeature3: IP Allowlist to prevent unauthorized access
clusterWizard.paidTierFeature6: Cloud shell to run SQL queries from the browser
clusterWizard.paidTierFeature7: Data encryption at rest and in transit
clusterWizard.paidTierFeature8: IP Allowlist to prevent unauthorized access
clusterWizard.freeTierBestFeat1: Development and product evaluation use cases
clusterWizard.paidTierBestFeat1: Evaluating YugabyteDB for production use cases
clusterWizard.faultToleranceTooltipFree: Only available for Paid tier clusters
clusterWizard.faultToleranceTooltipPaid:
None - No fault tolerance.
Node Level - Resilient to node level failures but not resilient to AZ outages. Requires min 3 nodes in a single AZ with a replication factor of 3.
Availability Zone Level - Resilient to cloud AZ failures. Requires min 3 nodes spread across multiple AZs with a replication factor of 3.

node.text: Resilient to node level failures but not resilient to Availability Zone outages.
node.setupText: Minimum 3 nodes in a single AZ with a replication factor of 3

zone.text: Resilient to cloud AZ failures. Maximum protection against data center failure
zone.setupText: Minimum 3 nodes spread across multiple AZs with a replication factor of 3

clusterWizard.vCpuPerNodeTooltip: Please, contact support for using grayed-out vCPUs
clusterWizard.diskSizeIncluded: {{value}} GB included in the base price
clusterWizard.diskSizeInvalid: Invalid disk size, decimals not allowed
clusterWizard.useVpc: Deploy this cluster in a dedicated VPC
clusterWizard.useVpcSubtitle: Recommended for production. Deploying into a dedicated VPC improves network security, reduces network latency and cost. Note! This can not be changed after cluster creation.
clusterWizard.noVpcForProvider: Currently you don't have a VPC for {{region}} region in {{cloud}}.
clusterWizard.vpcHelperText: This cannot be changed after cluster creation
clusterWizard.cantChangeLater: VPC peering settings cannot be changed after cluster creation .
clusterWizard.contactSupportForVpc: Contact support to request a VPC for your application.
clusterWizard.nodesMinValue: Number of nodes must be greater than zero
clusterWizard.nodesNoneLevelMaxValue: No fault tolerance requires number of nodes to be 1
clusterWizard.nodesNodeLevelMinValue: Instance level fault tolerance requires number of nodes to be at least {{value}}
clusterWizard.nodesAZLevelMinValue: Availability Zone level fault tolerance requires number of nodes to be at least {{value}}
clusterWizard.nodesAZLevelModuloValue: Availability Zone level fault tolerance requires number of nodes to be multiple of {{value}}
clusterWizard.cantValidateName: Failed to validate the cluster name, please try again
clusterWizard.clusterNameMaxLength: Cluster name is too long - max {{value}} chars are allowed
clusterWizard.clusterNameMinLength: Cluster name is too short - min {{value}} chars are required
clusterWizard.credsInfoAlert: Note! Your credentials are only temporarily visible. You will need these credentials when accessing your cluster.
clusterWizard.credsCopyValidation: In order to proceed you must first download your credentials
clusterWizard.credsUseSameForAll: Use same credentials for YSQL, YCQL APIs
clusterWizard.stableReleaseDesc: This release series includes fully tested new features and changes that are backward compatible.
clusterWizard.edgeTestReleaseDesc: This is an edge cutting release which marks the introduction of new features and improvements.
clusterWizard.edgeProdReleaseDesc: If you plan to deploy a production-ready cluster on Edge Releases, <1>{{contactSupport}}</1> for an approval.
clusterWizard.edgeReleaseContactSupport: Before deploying a production-ready cluster on Edge Releases, <1>{{contactSupport}}</1>
clusterWizard.customReleaseDesc: This is a custom release approved by the Yugabyte support team.
clusterWizard.freeTierDbVersionInfo: Free cluster will be on Edge Release with early access to new features and improvements.

connectModal.cloudShellCopy: Interact with your cluster using YugabyteDB Managed browser based shell environment
connectModal.clientShellCopy: Interact with your cluster using Yugabyte remote shell environment from your OS
connectModal.connectAppCopy: Connect your application to the cluster using native drivers
connectModal.sampleAppCopy: Load your cluster with a sample test data
connectModal.selectApiCopy: Select your API, driver and version
connectModal.shellConnectWarning: In order to connect to this cluster you must have at least one IP in the Allow List. <1>{{addIpLink}}</1>
connectModal.shellDownloadClientCopy: Select your OS and download the YugabyteDB client shell:
connectModal.shellDownloadCertCopy: Download the CA certificate to connect securely to the cluster
connectModal.shellDownloadCertHelpText: Copy the certificate file from your local machine to the yugabyte-client container using the following command
connectModal.shellRunInstruction: Run your remote shell with the following string
connectModal.codeBlockBinDir: You can find DB clients under the "bin" directory
connectModal.javaAppInstruction: To build Java applications with this driver, you must add the following Maven dependency to your application:
connectModal.connectStringCopy: Use the following parameters to connect to your cluster
connectModal.sampleInsertWorkloadDescription: This app writes out 2M unique string keys each with a string value. There are multiple readers and writers that write 2M keys and read 1.5M keys. To write the keys and read them indefinitely set num_reads & num_writes to -1. Note that the number of reads and writes to perform can be specified as a parameter.
connectModal.sampleUpdateWorkloadDescription: This app writes out 2M unique string keys each with a string value. There are multiple readers and writers that update 2M keys and read 1.5M keys. To update the keys and read them indefinitely set num_reads & num_writes to -1. Note that the number of reads and writes to perform can be specified as a parameter.
connectModal.documentation: For more information please see documentation
connectModal.clientShellYsqlMakeSure1: Replace {{DB_USER}} with the database user that connections will use by default. Later you will be prompted for the password for the database user
connectModal.clientShellYsqlMakeSure2: If you are connecting to database other than the default (yugabyte) replace {{YUGABYTE}} with your database name
connectModal.clientShellYcqlMakeSure2: Replace {{DB_USER}} with the database user that connections will use by default. Later you will be prompted for the password for the database user.
connectModal.connectAppYsqlMakeSure1: Replace {{DB_USER}} and {{DB_PASSWORD}} with your database credentials.
connectModal.connectAppYsqlMakeSure2: If you are connecting to a database other than the default (yugabyte) replace {{YUGABYTE}} with your database name
connectModal.connectAppYcqlMakeSure1: Replace {{DB_USER}} and {{DB_PASSWORD}} with your database credentials.
connectModal.connectAppYcqlMakeSure2: If you are connecting to a database other than the default (yugabyte) replace {{YUGABYTE}} with your database name
connectModal.addYcqlDriverCopy: Add YCQL java driver to your dependencies
connectModal.initializeContextCopy: Initialize SSLContext using the downloaded root certificate
connectModal.createSampleAppCopy: Create a sample app using the information provided above

clusterDetail.loadingTitle: Hold tight while we create your cluster. This can take 15-20 minutes
clusterDetail.provisioningCopy: Provisioning instances in the cloud with the requested configuration.
clusterDetail.bootstrappingCopy: Loading instance metadata and initializing the deployment process.
clusterDetail.installingSoftwareCopy: Installing software on each of the deployed machines.
clusterDetail.configuringClusterCopy: Configuring database on each of the deployed instances.
clusterDetail.loadingResourcesCopy: While you are waiting check out these resources:
clusterDetail.docsConnectCluster: How to connect to your cluster
clusterDetail.loadingAlertCopy: This information will be available once your cluster is ready.
clusterDetail.clusterReadyAlert: Your cluster is ready for use

editOpAlerts.updateGeneral: This cluster is being updated. Note that certain operations are not available while the operation is in progress.
editOpAlerts.updateOnFailedCluster: This operation is not allowed since the cluster is in failed state.
editOpAlerts.scalingResources: This cluster is updating node resources. Note that certain operations are not available while the update is in progress.

clusterDetail.pausedClusterWarning: Your cluster is paused due to inactivity. Please resume the cluster soon to continue using it.
clusterDetail.pausingClusterInfo: Your cluster is being paused due to inactivity. Please resume the cluster after this operation to continue using it.
clusterDetail.resumingClusterInfo: This cluster is resuming. Note that certain operations are not available while the resume is in progress.
clusterDetail.underMaintenanceInfo: This cluster is under maintenance. No operations are allowed to avoid unexpected conflicts.
clusterDetail.underUpgradeInfo: This cluster is upgrading database version. Note that certain operations are not available while the upgrade is in progress.
clusterDetail.contactSupportForFailedCluster: Cluster operation failed due to unexpected error. <1>{{contactSupport}}</1>

help.networkAccessDocs: Learn more about creating network access
help.useClientShell: Use YugabyteDB client shell to connect
help.interactWithCluster: Interact with your cluster using YugabyteDB Managed browser based shell environment

gettingStarted.tryYugabyteVoyager: Wondering how to load data into your cluster? Try our data migration application <0>{{voyagerText}}</0>, designed to move data to YugabyteDB quickly and securely.

getStartedSteps.createClusterDesc: Create a YugabyteDB cluster to get started
getStartedSteps.loadClusterDesc: Migrate your databases into the cluster using <0>{{migrationLink}}</0>

tables.noClusterTables: There are no cluster tables available
tables.noIndexTables: There are no index tables available
tables.noTabletsCopy: You do not have any tablets

voyager.name: Name
voyager.getStarted: Use YugabyteDB Voyager to manage end-to-end database migration, including cluster preparation, schema migration, and data migration. Voyager safely migrates data from PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Oracle databases to YugabyteDB Managed, YugabyteDB Anywhere, and the core open source database, YugabyteDB.

gettingStarted.noMigrationsDesc: Migrate your databases into the cluster using YugabyteDB Voyager, designed to move data to YugabyteDB quickly and securely.
gettingStarted.learnMore: Learn how to prepare your migration
gettingStarted.refreshNote: Refresh the page after connecting to your Voyager instance to see your migrations.

planAndAssess.heading: Migration Assessment Report
planAndAssess.assessmentPendingDesc: Run the analyze schema command for assessing the migration
planAndAssess.installVoyagerDesc: Install YugabyteDB Voyager on the cluster.
planAndAssess.specificVersion: Install a specific version of yb-voyager on your machine using the following command:
planAndAssess.assessMigrationDesc: Assess the source database to be migrated to check for database compatibility, evaluate cluster size requirements, and estimate migration complexity.

summary.heading: Summary
summary.complexityTooltipEasy: This migration is rated as <bold>Easy</bold>, as it requires <bold>0-20 manual schema changes</bold> and <bold>0 manual app changes</bold>. More details can be found in the <bold>Recommendations</bold> section.
summary.complexityTooltipMedium: This migration is rated as <bold>Medium</bold>, as it requires <bold>>20 manual schema changes</bold> and/or <bold>1-5 manual app changes</bold>. More details can be found in the <bold>Recommendations</bold> section.
summary.complexityTooltipHard: This migration is rated as <bold>Hard</bold>, as it requires <bold>>5 manual app changes</bold>. More details can be found in the <bold>Recommendations</bold> section.
summary.complexityLearn: Learn more about how migration complexity is calculated

sourceEnv.heading: Source Environment
sourceEnv.tooltip: Database Objects, features in use, and workload details

recommendation.heading: Recommendations
recommendation.tooltip: Facts based approach to sizing that leverages metadata from the source environment

schemaChanges.heading: Recommended Schema Changes
schemaChanges.automaticDDLImportTooltip: SQL objects that can be imported into YugabyteDB without DDL changes.
schemaChanges.manualRefactoringTooltip: Number of DDL statements requiring manual refactoring.
schemaChanges.invalidObjectCountTooltip: Invalid object count requiring manual refactoring.

migrateSchema.completeStepsTooltip: Complete the prior step(s) to proceed
migrateSchema.schemaExportDesc: If you have direct connectivity to the source database from the client machine where voyager is installed, initiate schema export by executing the <0>export schema</0> command of <1>yb-voyager</1>.
migrateSchema.schemaExportLearn: Learn more about how to export schema
migrateSchema.schemaAnalysisDesc: Analyze schema to generate Schema Analysis report which suggests changes to the source DB schema to make it appropriate for YugabyteDB
migrateSchema.schemaAnalysisLearn: Learn more about how to analyze schema
migrateSchema.rerunAnalysis: Rerun analyze schema after making the suggested modifications.
migrateSchema.schemaImportDesc: Use the following command to import schema to target database.
migrateSchema.schemaImportLearn: Learn more about how to import schema

migrateData.dataExportDesc: Use the following command to export data from source database.
migrateData.dataExportLearn: Learn more about how to export data
migrateData.dataImportDesc: Use the following command to import data to target database.
migrateData.dataImportLearn: Learn more about how to import data
migrateData.indexTriggerTargetDB: Index and trigger import to target database
migrateData.indexTriggerDesc: Import index and trigger to target database.
migrateData.indexTriggerLearn: Learn more about how to import index and trigger

maintenance.descriptionContent: This cluster is scheduled to upgrade to YugabyteDB v<1>{{version}}</1>. See <3>{{whatsNew}}</3>.
maintenance.noMaintenance: You do not have any scheduled maintenance

maintenancePreferences.title: Maintenance Preferences
maintenancePreferences.maintenanceWindowSubtitle: Maintenance windows are <1>{{weeklyFourHour}}</1> blocks of time during which the YugabyteDB Managed team may perform maintenance on the cluster. It may require cluster restart during the process, which disrupts service briefly.
maintenancePreferences.startTimeHelper: Hours shown in your local time zone
maintenancePreferences.exclusionPeriodSubtitle: You can define a temporary period during which the YugabyteDB Managed team will perform no maintenance on the cluster, up to {{period}} days.
maintenancePreferences.startEndDateSubtitle: The exclusion window will start at {{time}} of the start date, And end at {{time}} of the end date

sidePanel.title: Maintenance Details
sidePanel.whatWillContent1: YugabyteDB Managed will perform a Rolling upgrade of the cluster database, with zero cluster downtime.
sidePanel.whatWillContent2: During the upgrade, the cluster will not be highly available, will drop connections to the stopped node, and have reduced bandwidth.
sidePanel.withDownTimeUpgrade: 🚨🚨🚨 During the upgrade window this cluster will be <1>{{unavailable}}</1> for up to <3>{{downTime}}</3> minutes. Please plan your tasks accordingly.

confirmUpgradeNow.title: Upgrade DB Version
confirmUpgradeNow.description: Are you sure you want to upgrade the cluster DB to version {{version}} now?

delayUpgrade.title: Delay Maintenance
delayUpgrade.description: Are you sure you want to delay the DB upgrade maintenance to next window{{nextWindow}}?

performance.filterPlaceholder: Filter by column, or query text

backups.noBackups: You do not have any backups

backupNowTooltip.noTables: This cluster doesn't have any tables to take a backup
backupNowTooltip.clusterUpdating: Can't take backup when the cluster is in updating state
backupNowTooltip.clusterFailed: Can't take backup when the cluster is in failed state
backupNowTooltip.backupInProgress: Can't take backup when a backup is in progress
backupNowTooltip.clusterPausedOrResuming: Can't take backup for a cluster in paused, pausing or resuming state

deleteConfirmModal.title: Continue deleting backup?
deleteConfirmModal.description: Action will delete backup permanently from the system.

restoreBackupModal.title: Restore Backup

scheduledBackup.title: Scheduled backup
scheduledBackup.policySettingsTooltip: To edit policy settings first enable scheduled backups

restore.noRestores: You do not have any restores

settings.noAllowlistsCopy: You have not enabled IP Allow Lists for this cluster
settings.changeRegionInfo: You are changing regions. Do you want to migrate your backups to the new region?
settings.accessWarning: In order to connect to this cluster you must have at least one IP in the Allow List
settings.addAllowlistToast: Adding cluster allow list. This may take up to a minute.
settings.editAllowlistToast: Modifying cluster allow list. This may take up to a minute.

allow_list.title: IP Allow Lists
allow_list.helpText: This of IP/IP ranges that can access this cluster
allow_list.name: Name

clusterDetail.noShellForVpc: Cloud Shell is not available for clusters with VPC peering at this time.

clusters.pauseInfo: Following is the new cost for <bold>{{clusterName}}</bold> once its paused.
clusters.resumeInfo: Following is the new cost for <bold>{{clusterName}}</bold> once its resumed.

pauseClusterHelp.help1: Reads and writes will be disabled.
pauseClusterHelp.help2: Any configured alerts and health checks will not be triggered.
pauseClusterHelp.help4: Regular updates and maintenance won’t be performed.
pauseClusterHelp.help5: Any changes to the cluster configuration are not allowed.
pauseClusterHelp.help6: All data in the cluster will be saved and the cluster can be resumed at any time.

clusters.deletionErrorAlert: Note: This operation will delete the cluster and all of its data.
clusters.deleteModalCopy: Are you sure you want to terminate <1>{{cluster}}</1>? Please enter the cluster name to continue.

upgrade.upgradeScheduled: This cluster is scheduled to upgrade to YugabyteDB v{{version}}. See <1>{{whatsNew}}</1>.
upgrade.noDownTimeUpgrade: YugabyteDB Managed will upgrade the cluster in a <1>{{rollingManner}}</1> which will upgrade one node at a time with zero downtime.

vpc.subtitle: A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is a private Network that enables a more secure communication between clusters within that network. Learn more about
vpc.subtitleLink: how to setup a VPC in YugabyteDB Managed.
vpc.name: Name
vpc.nameHelper: VPC name can not be modified after creation
vpc.nameTooShort: Name is too short - min {{value}} chars are required
vpc.providerAwsQuota: Maximum {{value}} VPCs allowed per region in AWS
vpc.providerGcpQuota: Maximum {{value}} VPCs allowed globally in GCP
vpc.awsRegionHelper: Your VPC will be associated with this region
vpc.regionHelperGcp: VPCs created for GCP are created globally and are assigned to all regions supported by YugabyteDB Managed
vpc.cidrHelper: Resources created in this VPC will be assigned a private IP for secure communication within the specified range
vpc.cidrInvalidFormat: You have entered an invalid CIDR notation
vpc.cidrOverlapError: This IP range is reserved for YugabyteDB Managed internal operations
vpc.cidrOverlapRegionError: This IP range overlaps with another region range
vpc.cidrIncorrectMaskAws: Mask should be between /{{min}} and /{{max}} in AWS
vpc.cidrIncorrectMaskGcpAuto: Mask should be between /{{min}} and /{{max}} in GCP with auto regions
vpc.cidrIncorrectMaskGcpCustom: Mask should be between /{{min}} and /{{max}} in GCP
vpc.cidrPrivateSubnetError: Value should be within any of the following private IP ranges: {{ranges}}

emptyState.title: You don't have any VPCs
emptyState.subtitle: A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is a secure, isolated private network dedicated to your clusters. It improves security, provides better performance and reduces data transfer cost.
emptyState.link: Learn how to create VPCs in YugabyteDB Managed

vpc.terminateBody: Are you sure you want to terminate the VPC named <1>{{name}}</1>?
vpc.reservedIPs: Note! The following IP address ranges are reserved by YugabyteDB Managed for internal operations and can not be used:
vpc.noPeerings: This VPC does not have a peering connection
vpc.noClusters: No cluster has been deployed to this VPC
vpc.autoRegionsTooltip: Automated region selection, deploys a VPC in every region supported by GCP. In case of a newly supported region, the region will automatically be added to your VPC network.
vpc.customRegionsTooltip: Custom region selection requires you to manually select and manage the regions in your VPC network. You can always add additional regions once your VPC is created.
vpc.customRegionsSubtitle: Make sure to assign unique CIDR blocks for each region. CIDRs can not be the same or overlap across regions.
vpc.addCC: To create a VPC first add a credit card to this account.

emptyState.title: You don't have any peering connections
emptyState.subtitle: Create a VPC peering connection to route traffic between Yugabyte VPC and your application VPC using private IP addresses. It improves security, provides better performance and reduces data transfer cost.
emptyState.link: Learn how to create a peering connection
emptyState.noVpc: To add a peering connection first

peering.subtitle: Create a peering between YugabyteDB Managed VPC and your VPC to allow communication. Learn about
peering.subtitleLink: how to create a peering connection.
peering.name: Peering Name
peering.nameHelper: Peering name can not be modified after creation
peering.terminateWarning: Note! By terminating this peering connection, your applications connected via VPC peering will lose connectivity to your clusters.
peering.terminateBody: Are you sure you want to terminate <1>{{name}}</1> peering connection?
peering.awsNextSteps: Accept the peering connection request and create or edit an existing route table for the application VPC in your AWS account
peering.gcpNextSteps: Create a reciprocal VPC Peering in your GCP account

network.allowListInUse: This IP allow list is currently in use and can not be deleted.
network.peeringNotSupported: VPC Peering is not supported yet.
